MainClaim.text: "Heidegger's notion of ontotheology is contrasted with the materialist approaches of Badiou and Meillassoux in contemporary philosophy

Heideggerian ontotheology.text: "Heidegger's notion of ontotheology designates the tendency of Western philosophy to posit an absolute point of reference for all beings

s materialist approaches.text: "Badiou and Meillassoux's materialist approaches reject the Heideggerian finitization of thinking and instead adopt mathematics as their basic ontological model."

s critique of ontotheology.text: "Heidegger's critique of ontotheology is centered on the idea that ontotheological metaphysics fails to think the difference between being and that-which-is in positive terms."

s reintroduction of a divine entity.text: "Meillassoux reintroduces a divine entity that is no longer the ontotheological necessary being but a merely possible and contingent one."

Divinity in Badiou and Meillassoux.text: "Badiou's contemporary atheism and Meillassoux's reintroduction of a divine entity represent two different approaches to divinity in contemporary philosophy."

s ultimate god and divinity.text: "Heidegger's ultimate god and divinity are radically deabsolutized

s divinity.text: "Heidegger's divinity is a dimension of the meaningful taking-place (Ereignis) of being as a divinity always yet to come."
